On february 15, 2017
spacekadt

Hang on a second. It was asked if this is reportable, not sanctionable.

Anything that you believe to be overly toxic or playing against ones own team is absolutely reportable. Judges and mods have access to logs that you don't have and can see the whole picture. Whether he gets sanctioned or cleared is up in the air until the judgement is handed out, but as long as you're not reporting people all willy nilly, just about anything is reportable.

From what little I've seen here (and with the admission that we've only seen two messages that sound like a small minority), I personally think it's worth taking a closer look at.
On april 21, 2017
Secondary

Is it playing against your team (And so also against the rules) when a player never talks, spends AP on random stuff like repairing turrets, advancing projects we arent working on (in one case even completing a project when the vote was 3v3) and so on? Especially when told several times to stop advancing the wrong projects or when we havent voted. And to stop repairing things we dont need.
And a captain who just doesn't move the ship but instead keeps scanning for planets when we have a planet? Ofcourse we can kill these people but im wondering if they are also breaking the rule to not play against your team. (The chance of them being mush is slim)
On april 21, 2017
[1820396]

It's hard to say without seeing the logs of that specific case.

It MIGHT be, if the player is doing it all with purpose to make game harder for others. That might be a case with finishing wrong projects or going AFK with important stuff in inventory or refusing to move the ship even after being told to do so numerous times. It almost definitely isn't when it comes to fixing random doors, fuel tanks and turrets.

But too often I see reports of first-time players just testing what they can do in this game being called griefers. Some of them even dropped their walkie-talkies right after they ended tutorial, never reading the other players' advices to stop doing all those annoying things. Personally (other judges might be less lenient), I usually clear those reports unless there's a severe damage caused by them. After all, most of them got killed for their troubles, and others start being useful for their crew when the ship goes for longer voyage. That should be enough lesson for them for next ships.
Other times, people think they voiced their opinion on said "griefer's" actions clearly, while logs show that they actually didn't, and "griefer" could misunderstand what he's doing wrong.

Anyway, if in doubt, and you think that you exhausted all other ways to lead them back on the "right path," feel free to report. Judges will see the logs and decide whether the case was real griefing or just confused newbie not meaning any harm. And if their actions are harmful to the ship, don't shy away from killing the person - there's no reason to risk the whole ship.
On april 21, 2017
Morgaine

Is the captain following the very helpful tips? Is he communicating? Perhaps a quiet kind word in a private channel could help. Is the hacker kit available for someone else to hack and move ship instead?

Are they new? The game can be quite daunting. I was a total newbie (in the first month or two of the game going public) and after the ship, one of the crew contacted me and explained things in a nice way (I had chosen to play Roland, and the only skill I picked was Shooter). Without that, I might have given up the game as I had thought I was assassinated for no reason.

On april 21, 2017
[8744424]

Sometimes people don't have much time to spend on reading/writing and they don't bother reading the answers on thing they posted a day ago cos there're tons of other new messages in gen chat.
IMO, the best way to find out if a player doesn't understand something/is new/is griefing/being completely ignorant to ship's needs is - by sending a PM.
If a player doesn't know the major duties the character they've picked is responsible for - they might be new to the game or to this particular character. But if they've been contacted directly and explained what they should be doing/what their mistakes are, yet they keep acting same way and ignoring their direct duties or harming the ship with their actions (say, eating fruits that need to be planted, completing bad projects in spite of crew's decision and ship's needs, etc) despite being active - then there's obviously a problem involved.

On may 2, 2017
AlmightyBob

Is it against the rules for Mush to publicly declare that they are Mush and that they have an anonymush the humans don't know about while they're in the middle of attempting a Mush takeover? (as in, while 10 humans are still in the game).
On may 2, 2017
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

It is against the rules to declare that you're mush, except if your actions had already shown it. For instance, if a mush rampages and says "hahaha, I was mush and I got you", they're only stating the obvious.
On may 2, 2017
AlmightyBob

If they are accused of being Mush and act very suspiciously, is that enough to "show" it exactly?
On may 2, 2017
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

I'm not sure I understand the question, but you can't do an obvious mush action that has no consequence, just because you want to be killed but don't want to be sanctioned. That doesn't work. If you do an obvious mush action on purpose in order to be killed or just in order to say that you're mush, then it is the same as confessing that you are mush.

But if you do mush actions because you are playing your role as a mush, then there is nothing reportable. And saying "I am mush" when the human crew already know that you are mush is not a confession. You said the mush were "taking over the ship", that means that you are aware of who they are because they are acting in the open. I don't see anything wrong in that.

On may 17, 2017
[1319487]

Hypothetical question here with a frame for reference. Sorry in advance if it was already asked.

Being a mush, you can allege "amnesia" when converted back using the RFS. With that said, you would play from there on as if you had just started the game, without any knowledge of what happened, who were the other mushes, etc. I'm going with total-amnesia here.

Is it possible for you, as a mush, to do a Death-note roundabout and plan your re-conversion to the mush knowing that you would be injected with the RFS?

Let's imagine that I'm Terry, the only Tech on board. I booby-trap the 2 Oxygen tanks, the Alpha Bay 2, the 2 Fuel Tanks, etc. Then, I'm turned with the RFS back to human. I allege "amnesia" and go on with my life. Oxygen Tanks break and Terry, as the only Tech on board, jumps to fix them, getting spored. The cycle goes on until I get all the 3/4 spores needed for conversion. I do not go out and infect myself on purpose, but use a "total amnesia" to forget that the places were trapped in the first place, and just act as if I were human, without any bias.

Is this machiavellic plan allowed under SDF rules?
On may 17, 2017
factoryman942

I predict a 99% chance of a giant "NO" here.
On may 17, 2017
Dzanek

It's completely forbidden to do as you say.
On may 17, 2017
[8191292]

Dear Asgardian. I have read Your question and I must say that as interesting RPing wise Your idea is, that is something that is absolutly not allowed under SDF rules.

Why is it not allowed? Answer is simple - RPing can not go in a way of gameplaying. You as player will posses knowledge about those spores and even if You will RP total amnesia (reminder to everybody - killing player who claims amnesia just because he did so is forbidden!), You must take care of Your gameplay. From gameplay point of view, what You just suggested is just like using Mr. Cat to become mush. Or triple-sporing food and hiding it, than eating after being RFSed.

Yes! I know! Your idea does not look the same at first glance! After all You will perform actions that are required by Your character and You won't rush to get Your own spores infect you. But that is just first glance. In reality You do know that those spores are there and You will just tigger them off.

Also... Regarding knowing that You will be RFSed - if You are mush and You know You will be RFSed, than Your duty is to do every single thing to not allow that. Rampage, run away, sabotage research (by dismantling Mush Genome disk for example)... Do whatever You can to not allow that. Letting humans to RFS You is also against SDF rules on it's own rights. I know - sometimes You can't do anything to stop humans from using RFS. But even if that is the case Your duty as agent of mush is to cause as much harm as that is possible.
On may 17, 2017
[1319487]

The masterplan is always for the mush to win. Letting oneself be "cured" is only part of the plan. From there on, if all things go accordingly, you are reconverted and spend the rest of the ship above suspicion and allowed to act as a mush freely. Isn't that a greater goal than just a rampage?

In any case, the proposed plan is different than using the cat to infect yourself deliberately (if the crew knew it was infected), or triple eating infected food because there is no logic there and is clearly on purpose. Both are actions that are not part of the normal gameplay, which you correctly stated.

Using an amnesia scenario, my gameplay does not conflict with the spores. If there is something needed to be fixed, I would be the one to fix it. With or without spores. I wouldn't be infecting myself deliberately.

The same could be said about Chao trapping the turrets that he would later on use to shoot hunters, or a pilot trapping all the 3 bays. If all actions are gameplay-standard, do they still conflict with the rules?
On may 17, 2017
Aceb
Asgardian

[...]
Is it possible for you, as a mush, to do a Death-note roundabout and plan your re-conversion to the mush knowing that you would be injected with the RFS?

Let's imagine that I'm Terry, the only Tech on board. I booby-trap the 2 Oxygen tanks, the Alpha Bay 2, the 2 Fuel Tanks, etc. Then, I'm turned with the RFS back to human. I allege "amnesia" and go on with my life. Oxygen Tanks break and Terry, as the only Tech on board, jumps to fix them, getting spored. The cycle goes on until I get all the 3/4 spores needed for conversion. I do not go out and infect myself on purpose, but use a "total amnesia" to forget that the places were trapped in the first place, and just act as if I were human, without any bias. [...]

Amnesia "rule" save You from humans trying to hunt You down. That's unfair.
When You change teams (struck with RFS or converted), Your goals and teammates change, as so, You too. I don't understand RP idea anyone sees, because RPing being cured or converted, means Your character goals and points of view change VERY MUCH. This is how by common sense is should be.

There's no grey area in any case to be able betray your team (yes, You hipotetical situation is such one).

To sumarize this up:
If You play amnesiac, You do not reveal ANY information but also, You can't use the information You still have against your current team. But if You insist on not revealing anything, You can use spore sucker or super soap to remove those (not all in one go).
OR
If "Terrence" would insist on playing amnesiac, that player could give a word or two to Chun to clear spores and not reveal it to rest.
Try to apply logic. Why would RFS exist, which so many ways to revert yourself back to being mush right after? Not is it only bad way of RP but also, against spirit of the game

edit
AND NO. Mush plan can't work.
Try to use common sense.
You're a monster. You want to get rid of those who oppose You, basically a villain.
You're a human. You want to stop monsters. You can't allow them to spread!

If You're human but mush convert You. You're no longer trying to save humanity. It's irrevelant to You. You want to get rid of it. Say good-bye with passionate fire all around You.

If You're mush but humans cure You, You're no longer trying to get rid of humanity. You're no longer predator. You become one of those, who try to fight their way back. You're one of the heores.

There's nothing between. Otherwise:
Terrence hurr durr I will become mush after being cured! (mush story)
Jin Su hurr durr! I will get myself "secretly" converted, then I will kill all my new-comrades and become humanity hero! (human story)


Getting my point?
On may 17, 2017
[1319487]

The amnesia is a way to level the plainfield. I hate if a mush is converted to human and rats the other mushes. This is a game of intrigue. If you don't know whom the other mushes are, then they deserve to win. That's how I see the game.

If amnesia is allowed (and it is), and you don't actively attack the other mushes, then you are playing against the humans ultimate goal. So the "now you are human, work 100% in human team" does not apply in this scenario. You adapt the gameplay to the roleplay.

And again, I'm not suggesting here that I would actively try and get converted back. If pheromodem was researched, this plan would not work. But in a blank situation, no pheromodem, doing actions that apply directly to your character gameplay... I know that its a limbo, I'm only asking if its illegal.

On june 1, 2017
factoryman942

If you got sanctioned, it's likely because either a) another player on your ship reported you, or b) you did something really, really bad yourself, which got taken from Judges' hands up to Mods', or c) you literally reported half the ship for no clear reason.

There has to be a consensus amongst judges for a sanction to be applied.
Also, how are you to know that we didn't sanction the people you reported, hm?

Yes, killing without cause, reason or consensus amongst teammates can be seen as playing against one's team, or in serious cases simple griefing.

On june 1, 2017
[1820396]
AsgardianThis is the worst piece of advise that anyone can give here.

Actually, it's the best piece of advice you will ever get.

SDF can give general guidelines for what is or isn't sanctionable and can discuss hypothethical situations but as soon as we start talking about real case, there's no way to say anything for sure until all logs are seen. Too often, people have only limited knowledge of what is or was going on on the ship, their account of events is one-sided and/or their postions are inherently twisted by being on the ship. After all, there's a reason why judges and mods stay away from reports from their own ships.

Is it generally bad to kill people without reason? Sure. Is it generally good to discuss with rest of the crew before you kill someone? Definitely.
But, objectively, had Raluca reason to kill Finola? Can't be said, unless we see logs. Did she discuss killing Finola with Chun or someone else? Again, can't be said without seeing logs.

I'm not discussing here the validity of Raluca for killing Finola or not. The simple answer of: "if you think there is a problem, report" is actually terrible. But for more than one time the SDF have punished those who have reported on similar situations with limited knowledge of the events.

No, not the "report the entire ship". The "your report was one sided and the logs show that in the general term of events was wrong, here, have a few points for your curriculum".

On june 1, 2017
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?
AsgardianThe simple answer of: "if you think there is a problem, report" is actually terrible. As you well stated, our reports are one sided.

Several judges have told you that it is the right answer. If you think that someone has broken the rules, then you should report them.


But for more than one time the SDF have punished those who have reported on similar situations with limited knowledge of the events. The SDF usually warns people who send abusive reports, and rarely "punish" them with points. A warning and a punishment are not the same.

Abusive reports are generally reports that were sent against people who obviously did nothing wrong. We often get reports against the Mush for "griefing" the ship, by players who know that they were not human. Mush who play their role are not griefers. We also have lots of reports from people who complain of being killed "for no reason", and they quote their killer's message explaining those reasons. That is also absurd, since there was obviously a justification to the murder. Those are just two examples of reports that can be judged abusive, because they were clearly useless.

[8744424]

Asgardian, problem is - it isn't an argument, nor is it a discussion - you basically proclaimed SDF violates SDF rules here. Which is a groundless accusation since you have provided no facts for that (or things you consider as facts), so we could explain where you are missing something or misunderstand the reasoning.

Distrusting is one thing (and therefore this thread and mod inbox do exist!- to clear all the issues that might be caused by said "distrust" ) and false accusation - is a very different one.
Please think carefully going for the second one in order not to cause misleading of players.

If you have troubles with figuring what was your wrong-doing or think the sanction was unjustified - you can get all the explanation via mod inbox.

takes off mod hat and places it about 10 feet away from the soapbox

I debated saying something and started typing and deleted more times than I can count. But there's a big point bothering me here that never really got touched upon.

If you had both been human (which, to your knowledge, you were), what you did to Raluca was not ok. You flat out threatened to stay there, decreasing her morale (and even said as much... so you knew what you were doing), just because she wouldn't give up a bed. Why'd I even say something? So you don't repeat your actions. No bed on the ship *belongs* to any person. Just because you want a bed that someone else occupies is NOT a legitimate reason to kill (or try to kill) someone.
On june 4, 2017
Dzanek

I've seen several times two people fighting for one bed. The other beds were either occupied or a certain person felt the need to take the only bed in the room. The reasons were either having the more important job, being the first to occupy the bed, the one taking the bed was supposed to have full AP bar or being "confirmed human" when the other was not. They were kicking off each other and in the end either somebody gave up, sometimes becoming inactive starving out to the death or at least twice somebody being killed: once on accident where semi-active victim was on low HP, second time confirmed human getting killed on purpose. I see it's not alright to kick somebody active off the bed, but I get confused when asked if it's sanctionable. What do rules say about both people kicking off each other to take the bed and its fatal ending?
On june 4, 2017
[8191292]

Ah... Well Patryk - that is very situational really. It would depend on many factors if kicking somebody out of bed with fatal ending is sanctionable or not. As You Yourself pointed out - it may be done by accident when one that is kicking out of bed does not know that person using bed is low on HP (pro advice - read logs people!).

But let's follow situation that You provided (in a way that I do understand).

So... We have two players. Let's say Roland and Kuan Ti. Both have important job. KT is working as Tech on Plasma Shield, while Roland is Pilot and needs AP for shooting hunters. Ideally they should both get bed. They are both active and so far worked for benefit of their team. But they can not both get bed. Only one can get it. And insted of talking this over they start kicking each other out of beds. They do this all the time, whenver one comes online and sees that has been kicked out of bed - instantly kick another one out of it and claims bed for himself. Yes?

That kind of situation. And after few cycles one gets killed due to low HP. That is of course sanctionable. Those two players are already propably wasting more AP than they would get from having bed. Moreover their selfish gameplay hurts their team as whole (because neither hunters will be shooted down, nor Plasma Shield will be worked on, while AP spent on kicking each other will raise difficulty AND death following such conflict will mean 1 active crew member less and 1 morale for everybody less. Or two if pregnant! This could be KT and Hua conflict for example...). So absolutly sanctionable in that specific situation. For both of them. They both do know that kicking off hurts other crew member. They both know that when HP reaches zero, person dies. They deliberatly hurt each other. In that situation even if one of them would have better claim to bed, that is not reason to continue such fight till one dies. Of course - we assume that they are both in same team.
On june 4, 2017
spacekadt

The short and simple answer is "if you intended to kill the person for occupying a bed they had a legitimate reason to use, it's sanctionable".

In cases where pettiness consumes both people and multiple hits are registered from one or more participants, it's a very grey area. Perceived intent comes into play as well as trying to figure out where the line got crossed from reasonable to unreasonable. I'd say that if kicking someone out of bed comes to a fatal ending, it should be reported and let the judges look into it.

factoryman942

quite sure you can't take HK in a patroller

On august 2, 2017
Enigma

Factoryman has the right of it, the Mush are permitted to do as they please, however he also very importantly pointed out you would need to harm the human team's chance of victory and with exception of the oxygen tank sabotage you mention, none of the above actually do that particularly well, and even the oxy attack would need to be timed with a critical oxygen storage to be effective.

Sol needs neither fuel, nor food, nor the pasi to be achieved. At best you've just made a short trip without Eden prospects, at worst you've done nothing and just made life for your partner harder as now they've lost a comrade.

There is no 'right' way to Mush however so if you think you can see a win on a ship you try for it but you should discuss your plans with your partner. A solo mush is a sad mush!

I for some reason thought this was in the TiaC forum, so you should really listen to the judges and not me

On august 2, 2017
[1820396]

Also, those things are not so broken, as it might seem and/or game has mechanics that make it less broken. Just to make notes to your own examples:

1) There can't be more then 9 fuel units in the combustion chamber at once - it will be full. Also, fuel won't be burned, unless you actually move the ship - till then it can be taken out of combustion chamber and returned back to fuel tanks.

2) Food destruction works only, if the BIOS is set to destroy it on day change. Otherwise, the cooked food will just get slowly spoiled. True, default setting of BIOS to destroy cooked rations on day change, but it's usualy one of the first things humans set off after mush selection. And, well, before mush selection, there's no mush to use this tactics.

3) It might be night for you in your timezone, but Mush is played all around the world. There's high probability that someone will be active on every cycle. So this makes breaking the oxygen tanks viable only with very low oxygen level. And after that gets down to zero, people die only very slowly of suffocation - 1 person per cycle. Mushes included.

4) As factoryman mentioned, hacker kit can't be taken to patroller or Pasiphae. So the crew can still try to hack command terminal and abandon you. And there's "ghost mush sample" entry in Xyloph DB so even that might be negated by active comms officer.

5) Well, you can do that. But again, they can abandon you. And again, don't be so sure that no one is active on your night.
On august 2, 2017
[9466449]

The thing I wanted to address it's how easy it is to totally destroy the ship without using any mush skills or any strategy if you are not using mush tactics, but using griefer tactic.
As i mentioned before, human team can lose all 20 fuel, all food (switch neron settings, and just grind the rations in the microwave on the last minute of cycle 8, whoosh, magic), around 12 oxy, pashipae + some vital items possibly including mush sample on day 1, right after the selection. And the mush who did that not only alive and well in the safety of the space, but also spent only like 10 ap and some mp for all of this and can extract the spores whenever he wants too on top of this.

And thanks for input Enigma, but even without oxygen shortage the mush himself can grab 3 capsules + both tanks can leak around 9 if timed correctly, because i doubt that tech's on most of the ship will be active enough in like 2:00 yes, sometimes they will, but mostly not. Also if both mushes commit suicide on patrol ships (preferably leaving third behind, but they can return anytime and take a trip to sol too if timed correctly,), they can take with them the whooping 15 oxygen, and without any fuel and grown up trees on day 1. There is nothing the crew can do.

That's all cool, but he is not playing against players here, but against the game. And personally if I would be against the mush who'll use this tactic, I won't be impressed, I would be a bit well, you know... Even though i came up with such a plan myself and it won't be a total surprise to me like for the most other new, semi-new players.

Once again. This plan does not use.
1.) Mush skills
2.) Player interaction
3.) Team cooperation

And can't be countered at all in most cases, and even if it does it'll cripple the ship. The thing about hurting you own team is valid actually, but i doubt that it can be used, because desruction of fuel, food and mush sample are actually profitable for any mush, and oxy starvation is actually one of the most common tactics.
I just want to sleep well on Daedalus, knowing that i won't awake to the sound of "Pashipae radio broadcast" telling me that half of the ship resources are gone in 1 cycle and the only shred of a chance we have is to repair pilgred ASAP and jump to Sol with a hacker kit if it's still exists with a mush on board.
On august 2, 2017
[1820396]

Again, just some notes

- microwave has 4 charges, at most. Everything else has to be cooked manually, i.e. using APs.

- switching Neron settings either means you are an Neron admin or you hack BIOS. The latter might be a pretty intenstive job AP-wise.

- if you're leaving broken oxygen tanks to just technicians, that's just a bad gameplay on your side. Anyone can try to fix anything. And with oxygen reservoirs the chance of success is not so low, even.

All in all, there are reasons why we don't see using those tactics by mushes every day. And that reason is they are either not efficient enough, reliable enough, or versatile enough. They are okay to be used, when the circumstances are right, but other time they can be countered and using them is mistake on mush side. And thus there's no reason to ban them or anything.

On august 2, 2017
Enigma

The humans would never attempt to rush PILGRED knowing there was an alpha onboard still so they wouldn't have to stop a thing, and if they did they'd simply expose themselves, die, and THEN they would start work on PILGRED.

Any of the self sacrifice strategies you're talking about rely on a great many things as others are pointing out. Being NERON admin is the biggest and most obvious of them so far, because to steal the pasiphae you need to be either that or a pilot with incredible luck, but if you're either of those things you're not likely to be the commander so abandoning you, or simply completing the magnetic net and then pulling you back onboard to be murdered, have your items recovered, and then enabling more anti-mush research, is just the click of a button. (maybe some more if they have to unload the fuel you filled the tank with but that's still only takes 2 PA to do for movement conversion.

I would NEVER recommend such a plan because I personally don't like it but if you wanted a more effective way to kill a ship, simply taking out morale sources, or the technicians if more reliable and easier (but still not foolproof) than anything you've listed so far.

I will add though that I know you're new, and I was on your first ship, (as was Chime) so I'm very happy to see you taking such an active interest in the game!

I do feel that we're derailing the SDF thread however...

On august 2, 2017
[9466449]

I'll derail a thread just a little bit more clarifying what i meant to say. Sorry about that i'm going in length here. I had to create a different thread for that .
I was talking about well, pve way of destroying the ship not pvp. And actually you don't actually need to destroy everything i listed, just a few things. I was corrected a few times, there actually some mechanic in place to remedy this, but not fully.
1.) Food - one mush with 2 spores (he can get 4 i guess and have ap to get into pashie) can cook around 24 rations with microwave if i count right. That makes all food stocks after selection probably so the humans will have around 2 days after this to get to Sol or starve hard especially if you hide\take the bananas and all. That will force humans to try and find the second mush and repair pilg in 2 days or less, or they will lose. It's pretty hard. (especitally hard if food destruction wouldn't be noticed immedtiately)
(you must be neron admin or Janice should just be a bit slow for it to work)
2.) Fuel - you can exaust 18 fuel in 2 cycles if you are a commander (or harder with hacker). It won't cost much ap and can be done fast. If there is noone who can stop you in 2 cycles and 2 fuel was already spent. The tank is empty and they can't even leave you and you are perfectly safe (well almost there is oxy trick that won't work if you have oxy capsule yourself and maybe hunters too, also trader can come... and you'll shoot it from patrol) in the pashie\patrol after that.
3.) Oxy - if you are safe in the pashie (see 2.) you can break oxy tanks each day for fun and nothing can stop you. Also if you manage to break tanks few times after day 1 and grab some capsules most of the time it will be enough to kill ill organized ship. Especially if they forced to jump to leave\magnet you and not astroscan.
4.) Hacker - If you managed to hide well\give to a teammate\lose hacker kit and you are commander, there is nothing the crew can do to you in the pashipae, and you can terrorise them all you want, with oxy tanks destroying as easiest strategy.

Well something like this. It's more like guidlenes for mush that are not meant to be in this thread but still my opinion that doing one of this things greatly improves mush chances in most cases. Because you are using one of you members as a resourse to keep whole crew busy, while second mush get all the chances it wants, even if the crew somehow manage to survive the above. It can get absurd if there x3 mushes, and even worse with sleeping mush i guess.
And what I wanted to say is if anything of the above goes "meta", the fun will be ruined hard for everyone. Well i'm new here, but already seen enough examples of how mush in the pashie can ruin a game by itself, but if he actually knows what he is doing and prepared for it from the start, then for most random ships it's a game over.
Most of the mashes tend to avoid the partoller trick even if they know about it, so i guessed, maybe there is some unspoken rule about it except the "partyruiner" kind of rule.

Excuse me for my blathering I have nothing better to do.
